Legal_Issue: Did the citizenship judge correctly determine that Dr. Ahmed failed to meet the residence requirements under paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act?
Application_Facts: Dr. Ahmed was present for only 235 days in the four years before his application. Evidence showed he did not establish residence before leaving for Afghanistan.
Decision_Outcome: The citizenship judge's decision was correct; Dr. Ahmed did not meet the residence requirement.
Remedy_Requested: Appeal to Federal Court to overturn the citizenship judge's decision
Grounds_for_Claim: Inadequate analysis and failure to consider surrounding circumstances by the citizenship judge
Legal_Standard: Applicant must accumulate at least 1095 days of residence in Canada within four years preceding the application
Assessment_Factor: Number of days physically present in Canada
Procedural_Issue: Appeal to Federal Court challenging administrative decision
Evidence_Used: Record of Dr. Ahmed’s physical presence (235 days)
Evidence regarding lack of established residence in Canada
Evidence_Assessed: Dr. Ahmed’s residency history and ties to Canada
Relief_Sought: Overturning of the citizenship judge’s decision and approval of citizenship application
Governing_Rule: Paragraph 5(1)(c) of the Citizenship Act requires 1095 days of physical residence within four years prior to application
Evidentiary_Deficiency: Failure to provide sufficient evidence of residence in Canada
Cause_Description: Dr. Ahmed's citizenship application was denied due to insufficient residency days
Evidence_Handling: The court reviewed the evidence of Dr. Ahmed’s presence and residence patterns
Evidence_Issues: Lack of proof establishing residential ties in Canada
Residency_Compliance: Failed – only 235 days of residence in the required period
Evidence_Assessment: Evidence showed Dr. Ahmed did not establish residence in Canada prior to departure
Decision_Rationale: Dr. Ahmed did not meet the statutory residence requirement of 1095 days and failed to prove establishment of residence
Decision_Making_Body: Citizenship judge, reviewed by Federal Court
Evidentiary_Issues: Insufficient documentation or proof of Canadian residence
Legal_Standard_Applied: Objective assessment of physical presence and residence establishment under the Citizenship Act
